content.question: The claim in the second paragraph that the king has become “free from all physical desire” can best be understood to mean that

choices.label: Southeast Asian states’ ruling elites were very wealthy.
in Vedic religions, rejecting worldly concerns in order to attain spiritual perfection was considered a virtue.
Buddhist monks and nuns in Southeast Asian societies were required to maintain an ascetic lifestyle.
Hindus believed that members of each caste had different rights and responsibilities.

content.answer: in Vedic religions, rejecting worldly concerns in order to attain spiritual perfection was considered a virtue.
